int table_data_add_row (  table_data *    table,
table_row *    row
) 
 

Adds a row of data to a given table (in proper lexographical order).

returns SNMPERR_SUCCESS on successful addition. or SNMPERR_GENERR on failure (E.G., indexes already existed)

Definition at line 35 of file table_data.c.

00036 {
00037     table_row *nextrow, *prevrow;
00038     
00039     if (row->indexes)
00040         table_data_generate_index_oid(row);
00041 
00042     /* we don't store the index info as it
00043        takes up memory. */
00044     snmp_free_varbind(row->indexes);
00045     row->indexes = NULL;
00046 
00047     if (!row->index_oid) {
00048         snmp_log(LOG_ERR, "illegal data attempted to be added to table %s\n",
00049                  table->name);
00050         return SNMPERR_GENERR;
00051     }
00052 
00053     /* insert it into the table in the proper oid-lexographical order */
00054     for(nextrow = table->first_row, prevrow = NULL;
00055         nextrow != NULL;
00056         prevrow = nextrow, nextrow = nextrow->next) {
00057         if (snmp_oid_compare(nextrow->index_oid, nextrow->index_oid_len,
00058                              row->index_oid, row->index_oid_len) > 0)
00059             break;
00060         if (snmp_oid_compare(nextrow->index_oid, nextrow->index_oid_len,
00061                              row->index_oid, row->index_oid_len) == 0) {
00062             /* exact match.  Duplicate entries illegal */
00063             snmp_log(LOG_WARNING,
00064                      "duplicate table data attempted to be entered\n");
00065             return SNMPERR_GENERR;
00066         }
00067     }
00068 
00069 
00070     /* ok, we have the location of where it should go */
00071     /* (after prevrow, and before nextrow) */
00072     row->next = nextrow;
00073     row->prev = prevrow;
00074     
00075     if (row->next)
00076         row->next->prev = row;
00077 
00078     if (row->prev)
00079         row->prev->next = row;
00080 
00081     if (NULL == row->prev)       /* it's the (new) first row */
00082         table->first_row = row;
00083     
00084     DEBUGMSGTL(("table_data_add_data", "added something...\n"));
00085 
00086     return SNMPERR_SUCCESS;
00087 }

int table_data_helper_handler (  mib_handler *    handler,
handler_registration *    reginfo,
agent_request_info *    reqinfo,
request_info *    requests
) 
 

The helper handler that takes care of passing a specific row of data down to the lower handler(s).

It sets request->processed if the request should not be handled.

Definition at line 158 of file table_data.c.

00162                                          {
00163

00174         if (request->processed)
00175             continue;
00176 
00177         table_info = extract_table_info(request);
00178         if (!table_info)
00179             continue; /* ack */
00180 
00181         /* find the row in question */
00182         switch(reqinfo->mode) {
00183             case MODE_GETNEXT:
00184             case MODE_GETBULK: /* XXXWWW */
00185                 if (request->requestvb->type != ASN_NULL)
00186                     continue;
00187                 /* loop through data till we find the next row */
00188                 result = snmp_oid_compare(request->requestvb->name,
00189                                           request->requestvb->name_length,
00190                                           reginfo->rootoid,
00191                                           reginfo->rootoid_len);

00193                                              SNMP_MIN(request->requestvb->name_length, reginfo->rootoid_len),
00194                                              reginfo->rootoid,

00196                 if (regresult == 0 &&
00197                     request->requestvb->name_length < reginfo->rootoid_len)
00198                     regresult = -1;
00199                 
00200                 if (result < 0 || 0 == result) {
00201                     /* before us entirely, return the first */
00202                     row = table->first_row;
00203                     table_info->colnum = table_reg_info->min_column;
00204                 } else if (regresult == 0 && request->requestvb->name_length ==
00205                            reginfo->rootoid_len + 1) {
00206                     /* exactly to the entry */
00207                     row = table->first_row;
00208                     table_info->colnum = table_reg_info->min_column;
00209                 } else if (regresult == 0 && request->requestvb->name_length ==
00210                            reginfo->rootoid_len + 2 &&
00211                            request->requestvb->name[reginfo->rootoid_len-2] ==
00212                            1) {
00213                     /* exactly to the column */
00214                     row = table->first_row;
00215                 } else {
00216                     /* loop through all rows looking for the first one
00217                        that is equal to the request or greater than it */
00218                     for(row = table->first_row; row; row = row->next) {
00219                         /* compare the index of the request to the row */
00220                         result =
00221                             snmp_oid_compare(row->index_oid,
00222                                              row->index_oid_len,
00223                                              request->requestvb->name + 2 +
00224                                              reginfo->rootoid_len,
00225                                              request->requestvb->name_length -
00226                                              2 - reginfo->rootoid_len);
00227                         if (result == 0) {
00228                             /* equal match, return the next row */
00229                             if (row) {
00230                                 row = row->next;
00231                             }
00232                             break;
00233                         } else if (result > 0) {
00234                             /* the current row is greater than the
00235                                request, use it */
00236                             break;
00237                         }
00238                     }
00239                 }
00240                 if (!row) {
00241                     table_info->colnum++;
00242                     if (table_info->colnum <= table_reg_info->max_column) {
00243                         row = table->first_row;
00244                     }
00245                 }
00246                 if (row) {
00247                     valid_request = 1;
00248                     request_add_list_data(request, create_data_list(TABLE_DATA_NAME, row, NULL));
00249                 } else { /* no decent result found.  Give up. It's beyond us. */
00250                         request->processed = 1;
00251                 }
00252                 break;
00253 
00254             case MODE_GET:
00255                 if (request->requestvb->type != ASN_NULL)
00256                     continue;
00257                 /* find the row in question */
00258                 if (request->requestvb->name_length <
00259                     (reginfo->rootoid_len + 3)) {  /* table.entry.column... */
00260                     /* request too short */
00261                     request->processed = 1;
00262                     break;
00263                 } else if (NULL ==

00272                     request->processed = 1;
00273                     break;

00276                     request_add_list_data(request, create_data_list(TABLE_DATA_NAME, row, NULL));
00277                 }
00278                 break;

00280             case MODE_SET_RESERVE1:

00282                 if (NULL !=

00292                 break;

00294             case MODE_SET_RESERVE2:

00300
